org.sertain.hardware

Class BreakWhenStarted

  • org.sertain.hardware.BreakWhenStarted
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RobotLifecycle

    public class BreakWhenStarted
implements RobotLifecycle

    Puts all specified talons in break mode when the robot is enabled in either teleop or autonomous mode, and will disable break mode 5 seconds after the robot is disabled in order to allow the robot to be pushed around on the field.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.sertain.RobotLifecycle

        RobotLifecycle.Companion, RobotLifecycle.DefaultImpls

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface org.sertain.RobotLifecycle

        Companion

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BreakWhenStarted(NonExistentClass talons)
      Puts all specified talons in break mode when the robot is enabled in either teleop or autonomous mode, and will disable break mode 5 seconds after the robot is disabled in order to allow the robot to be pushed around on the field.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void execute()
      Runs periodically (default = every 20ms) while the robot is turned on. It need not be enabled for this method to be called.
      void executeAuto()
      Runs periodically (default = every 20ms) while the robot is in the autonomous mode.
      void executeDisabled()
      Runs periodically (default = every 20ms) while the robot is in the disabled state.
      void executeTeleop()
      Runs periodically (default = every 20ms) while the robot is in the teleoperated mode.
      void onAutoStart()
      Indicates that the robot is being enabled in the autonomous mode. This method will be called before the robot becomes enabled in autonomous mode.
      void onAutoStop()
      Indicates that the autonomous mode has just terminated. This method will be called after the autonomous mode has terminated.
      void onCreate()
      Indicates robot creation. This method will be called exactly once right after basic robot initialization has occurred. This is a good time to perform any setup necessary for the entire robot's lifetime.
      void onDisabledStop()
      Indicates that the disabled state has just terminated. This method will be called after the disabled state has terminated. This method should be equivalent to RobotLifecycle.onStart.
      void onStart()
      Indicates that the robot is being enabled. This method will be called before the robot becomes enabled in either the teleoperated or autonomous mode. This would be a good time to perform actions to prepare the robot for movement.
      void onStop()
      Indicates that the robot has become disabled. This method will be called upon entering the disabled state.
      void onTeleopStart()
      Indicates that the robot is being enabled in the teleoperated mode. This method will be called before the robot becomes enabled in teleoperated mode.
      void onTeleopStop()
      Indicates that the teleoperated mode has just terminated. This method will be called after the teleoperated mode has terminated.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.sertain.RobotLifecycle

        execute, executeAuto, executeDisabled, executeTeleop, onAutoStart, onAutoStop, onCreate, onDisabledStop, onStart, onStop, onTeleopStart, onTeleopStop

    • Constructor Detail

      • BreakWhenStarted

        public BreakWhenStarted(NonExistentClass talons)

        Puts all specified talons in break mode when the robot is enabled in either teleop or autonomous mode, and will disable break mode 5 seconds after the robot is disabled in order to allow the robot to be pushed around on the field.

        Parameters:
        talons - the Talons to enable Auto Break on

    • Method Detail

      • onStart

        public void onStart()

        Indicates that the robot is being enabled. This method will be called before the robot becomes enabled in either the teleoperated or autonomous mode. This would be a good time to perform actions to prepare the robot for movement.

      • onStop

        public void onStop()

        Indicates that the robot has become disabled. This method will be called upon entering the disabled state.

      • onCreate

        public void onCreate()

        Indicates robot creation. This method will be called exactly once right after basic robot initialization has occurred. This is a good time to perform any setup necessary for the entire robot's lifetime.

      • onTeleopStart

        Indicates that the robot is being enabled in the teleoperated mode. This method will be called before the robot becomes enabled in teleoperated mode.

      • onAutoStart

        Indicates that the robot is being enabled in the autonomous mode. This method will be called before the robot becomes enabled in autonomous mode.

        Runs periodically (default = every 20ms) while the robot is turned on. It need not be enabled for this method to be called.

      • executeDisabled

        Runs periodically (default = every 20ms) while the robot is in the disabled state.

      • executeAuto

        public void executeAuto()

      • onTeleopStop

        Indicates that the teleoperated mode has just terminated. This method will be called after the teleoperated mode has terminated.

      • onAutoStop

        public void onAutoStop()

        Indicates that the autonomous mode has just terminated. This method will be called after the autonomous mode has terminated.

      • onDisabledStop

        public void onDisabledStop()

        Indicates that the disabled state has just terminated. This method will be called after the disabled state has terminated. This method should be equivalent to RobotLifecycle.onStart.
